member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources before the object is reclaimed by .

member.summary: Releases all the resources used by the object.

member.name: M:PIAdapters.PIConnection.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.

member.summary: Attempts to open .

member.summary: Closes .

member.name: M:PIAdapters.PIConnection.Execute(System.Action{PISDK.Server})
member.summary: Executes an action against the on its STA operations thread.
member.remarks: This method ensures that each operation on OSI-PI server object is handled synchronously on its primary STA thread.

member.name: M:PIAdapters.PIConnection.CompareTo(PIAdapters.PIConnection)
member.summary: Compares the current object with another object of the same type.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This object is less than the parameter. Zero This object is equal to . Greater than zero This object is greater than .
member.param: An object to compare with this object.

member.summary: Raised when has been disconnected from server.

member.name: M:PIAdapters.PIConnectionPool.GetPooledConnection(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a connection from the pool or creates a new one if all current connections are being used at peak access.

Name of the PI user ID for the adapter's PI connection.
Password used for the adapter's PI connection.
Timeout interval (in milliseconds) for the adapter's connection.
member.exception: Failed to get a pooled PI connection.

member.summary: Connects to the configured PI server.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIRTInputAdapter.UseEventPipes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for whether the adapter will use event pipes. If event pipes are disabled, the adapter will use polling.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to query when the adapter is polling instead of using event pipes.

member.summary: Returns false to indicate that this does NOT connect asynchronously

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIRTInputAdapter.SupportsTemporalProcessing
member.summary: Returns false to indicate that this does NOT support temporal processing. Temporal processing is supported in a separate adapter that is not driven by event pipes.
